Hey, so I am trying to figure out how to use Labview for my team and it is a headache. Like we tried using the code FRC gave us in the docs but its all in PWM and we tried switching to CAN the best we could so we created our own code which I think is a mix of teleop.vi and begin.vi. I am trying to figure out how to separate begin.vi and teleop.vi from our code. And the more annoying part is that I am unable to upload it shows a error. So could you guys please help me out?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":48,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T14:07:38.532Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":132,"readers_count":131,"score":41.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484469,"topic_slug":"help-with-using-labview","display_username":"Cypress Creek High School","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":27189,"username":"klhutchi","name":"klhutchi","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/58956e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69272,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cy-Bears"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-using-labview/484469/6","custom_user_title":"Cy-Bears","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3497821,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T14:10:19.497Z","cooked":"

Begin.vi and close.vi only happen once. You will have both and can think of them as corresponding. Teleop.vi is the continuous actions of the devices. You probably also want to put the CartesianMeccanum definition in begin.vi.

If you are using CAN devices, ensure that you have installed the correct libraries. REVLib Overview | REV ION Brushless

As a possibly more important question, does your team have anyone who knows LabVIEW? If not, you might want to consider switching to a more standard language where things will be easier.

So my team does not have anybody that knows LabVIEW completely me and a few other of my friends know some bits and pieces and we are trying to combine what we know to work. And like one person in our team knows Python I think. I have suggested to our team captain again and again it would be much easier to use python because we could use help from ai or our teacher but he says that we don’t know python so we shouldn’t use it but we don’t know LabVIEW either. He believes that LabVIEW is much simpler than the other languages.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":48,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T15:22:48.259Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":120,"readers_count":119,"score":34.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484469,"topic_slug":"help-with-using-labview","display_username":"Cypress Creek High School","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60512,"username":"four","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69272,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cy-Bears"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-using-labview/484469/8","custom_user_title":"Cy-Bears","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3497900,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T16:02:14.388Z","cooked":"

Okay, what this seems like is your captain thinks LabVIEW is easier because it is graphical. That is an understandable assumption, but in practice, LabVIEW is a very niche language used by the fewest number of teams and receiving the poorest vendor support.

As for the one person who knows Python, how well do they know it? Well enough to carry the team? If not and no one has solid experience in LabVIEW or Python, your best chances of success are by using Java. As far as I understand, you do not have any people that know Java, but that is what you will need to take advantage of the most examples, copy code from other teams, receive the best vendor support and get the most help from the community.

@Peter_Johnson and @jdaming might have opinions on this.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":48,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T16:07:53.088Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":41.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484469,"topic_slug":"help-with-using-labview","display_username":"Gerardo Inzunza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49731,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Drive Coach 3598"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-using-labview/484469/10","custom_user_title":"Drive Coach 3598","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3497920,"name":"Jason Daming","username":"jdaming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdaming/{size}/137720_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T16:17:21.597Z","cooked":"

I worked at NI and trained customers to use LabVIEW. Then I used to spend my entire day job doing LabVIEW. I was a LabVIEW Architect the highest certification that NI has. So with all of that LabVIEW knowledge what do 99% of the teams I help use: Java. I also recommend and push them towards Java.

The most important thing for a new team when choosing a language is by far the community support (assuming there isn’t extremely strong mentor or student knowledge). As a new team I would spend the vast majority of your time reading and studying other teams code (FIRST is great for that in that there is wealth of both past and current code that you can literally copy, and then slightly modify to fit your situation).

I don’t agree that LabVIEW is “dead” like many on here may say, but it has a limited scope where it really excels. Even if there are some advantages (debugging etc) those don’t come close to balancing out the community and vendor support.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":48,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T16:18:09.810Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":106,"readers_count":105,"score":116.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484469,"topic_slug":"help-with-using-labview","display_username":"Jason Daming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":69272,"username":"CCHS","name":"Cypress Creek High School","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/ee7513/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18342,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-using-labview/484469/11","custom_user_title":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3497927,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T16:23:49.562Z","cooked":"

And really, with tools like TunerX that give you all the graphical control and feedback for setup, Java isn’t that far behind in debugging.

Yeah, the ability to click lines and see data real time can be helpful, but putting in Printfs does the same thing in the end, it just takes a couple minutes longer.

We used Labview until 2 years ago, but couldn’t continue to justify it with all the extra work that is required to integrate community tools like pathplanner etc.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":48,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T16:25:07.148Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":103,"readers_count":102,"score":35.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484469,"topic_slug":"help-with-using-labview","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":18342,"username":"jdaming","name":"Jason Daming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdaming/{size}/137720_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-using-labview/484469/12","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3498002,"name":"Elkbits","username":"Elkbits","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/elkbits/{size}/8480_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T17:30:06.057Z","cooked":"

maybe start a little earlier in the process if you are not familiar with LabView.
Have you imaged the RoboRIO?. Run the REV and CTRE installers? Loaded the CTRE library to the RoboRIO? … not sure what exact errors your are getting but any one of those can cause headaches trying to deploy code.

If you do not have someone who knows LabView in particular on your team, you should not be using LabView.

You should use Java, and base your code on the kitbot code or the RapidReactCommandBot example project.

GitHub Copilot and ChatGPT won’t know much of the interfaces and libraries; however, if you have people on the team that are proficient in Python, point that out.

As far as LabVIEW, please feel free to PM me and I’ll send you my email and phone number (I’m in Texas, and am assuming not close enough for in person).

I do have some (slightly older) “how to get started in LV for FRC” video content here that will probably be useful if you choose to stay in LabVIEW:

YouTube

Matthew

Share your videos with friends, family, and the world

As far as where to see errors, they should be coming through the Driver Station log viewer
